name: isoseq-annotation
title: PacBio Iso-Seq Isoform Annotation (nf-core/isoseq)
description: Genome annotation from PacBio Iso-Seq long-read sequencing. Generates full-length transcript isoforms, identifies novel splice variants, and creates high-quality gene models from circular consensus sequences. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq`
content:
PacBio Iso-Seq Isoform Annotation

The nf-core/isoseq pipeline performs genome annotation from PacBio Iso-Seq long-read sequencing data, producing full-length transcript isoforms and high-quality gene models.

PacBio Iso-Seq Advantages

  • Full-Length Transcripts: Complete 5' to 3' transcript sequences
  • Isoform Detection: Unambiguous splice variant identification
  • Novel Discovery: Find unannotated genes and isoforms
  • No Assembly Artifacts: Direct sequencing avoids reconstruction errors
  • Fusion Detection: Identify fusion transcripts

Scientific Applications

  • Genome Annotation: Create comprehensive transcript catalogs
  • Alternative Splicing: Characterize splice variants
  • Novel Gene Discovery: Identify unannotated genes
  • Isoform Quantification: Full-length transcript abundance
  • Fusion Detection: Find chimeric transcripts
  • Non-model Organisms: Annotate genomes without reference

Pipeline Features

  • CCS Generation: High-accuracy circular consensus sequences
  • FLNC Extraction: Full-length non-chimeric reads
  • Genome Mapping: Minimap2 splice-aware alignment
  • Isoform Clustering: Group similar transcripts
  • Gene Model Refinement: uLTRA and TAMA annotation
  • Quality Control: Comprehensive QC metrics

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • bam: PacBio subreads BAM file
  • pbi: PacBio index (pbi) file
  • reads: Optional pre-generated CCS reads

Key Outputs

  • Gene Models: GTF/GFF annotation files
  • FLNC Reads: Full-length non-chimeric sequences
  • Isoform Clusters: Grouped transcript variants
  • Quality Metrics: CCS accuracy, FLNC yields
  • Abundance Estimates: Isoform quantification

Perfect for: Genome annotation • Isoform discovery • Alternative splicing • Novel gene finding • Non-model organisms
